questionnaires.question:
What is the output of the following program?

#include<iostream>
using namespace std;
class abc {

   public:
      int i;

      abc(int i) {
         i = i;
      }
};

main() {
   abc m(5);
   
   cout<<m.i;
}
Which is the storage specifier used to modify the member variable even though the class object is a constant object?
We can use this pointer in static member function of the class.
Objects created using new operator are stored in __ memory.

i) Exception handling technically provides multi branching.

What is the output of the following program?

#include<iostream>

using namespace std;
void swap(int m, int n) {
   int x = m;
   m = n;
   n = x;
}
main() {
   int x = 5, y = 3;  
   swap(x,y);
   cout<<x<<" "<<y;
}
